verb.description: Arrange to receive something regularly, typically a publication, by paying in advance.
examples: subscribe to the magazine for twelve months and receive a free T-shirt

verb.description: Express or feel agreement with (an idea or proposal)
examples: we prefer to subscribe to an alternative explanation

verb.description: Sign (a will, contract, or other document)
examples: he subscribed the will as a witness

origin: Late Middle English (in the sense sign at the bottom of a document): from Latin subscribere, from sub- under + scribere write.
